page.title: 14 Whippinham Primary School
page.content:
On Friday 5th of July we visited Whippingham School to find out some interesting facts about the school today compared with what it was like in Victorian times. Here are our findings.
Whippingham School was built in 1853. The school has the following rooms: three classrooms, a large hall, video, Staff, activity, medical, kitchen, office, book, toilets. The number of children in the school then would have been 50. Today the school has 46 children on roll. In 1853 you had to pay to go to school. A committee bought the books and the Head Teachers wife had to get the older girls to clean the classrooms and to make sure that the children were clean and tidy.
